summary: Frontend testing completed for TABLE 4 - ANTI-SEIZURE MEDICATIONS expansion from 10 to 32 medications. All features verified working correctly.

tests: Login with test@test.com / 12341234 works
Accept Medical Disclaimer modal works
Navigate to /children/approaches works
Select 'Epilepsy - Including Status (SMC)' from dropdown works
TABLE 4 - ANTI-SEIZURE MEDICATIONS section is visible
Table header displays correctly with blue background
6 columns present: Drug, Initial Dose, Max (mg/kg/day), Adult Max (mg/day), Available Forms (SMC), Side Effects
32 medications present in TABLE 4

Medications verified: Acetazolamide, Biotin, Brivaracetam, Bromide (K+), Carbamazepine, Cenobamate, Clobazam, Clonazepam, Eslicarbazepine, Ethosuximide, Felbamate, Folinic acid, Gabapentin, IVIG, Lacosamide, Lamotrigine, Levetiracetam, Methylprednisolone, Nitrazepam, Oxcarbazepine, Perampanel, Phenobarbital, Phenytoin, Prednisolone, Pregabalin, Primidone, Pyridoxine, Retigabine, Rufinamide, Sodium Valproate, Topiramate, Vigabatrin
Weight input field (kg) accepts value
Calculated doses displayed in green text when weight entered (20 kg test)
Carbamazepine shows 100mg/d for 20kg
Clobazam shows 5.0mg/d for 20kg
Clonazepam shows 2.00mg/d for 20kg
Status epilepticus doses also update with weight
Brivaracetam shows 'Not available' in red text
Cenobamate shows 'Not available' in red text
Eslicarbazepine shows 'Not available' in red text
Felbamate shows 'Not available' in red text
Retigabine shows 'Not available' in red text
Lamotrigine shows 'Allergic reaction (SJS)' in red bold text
Vigabatrin shows 'Visual field defect (irreversible)' in red bold text
Table has overflow-x-auto class for horizontal scrolling
Table has min-w-[700px] for proper mobile display

critical_code_review_comments: TABLE 4 successfully expanded from 10 to 32 medications matching PDF guideline
New Adult Max (mg/day) column added correctly
Weight-based calculations properly implemented using {w > 0 && ...} conditional rendering
Red text styling for 'Not available' medications using text-red-500 class
Critical side effects (SJS, Visual field defect) highlighted with text-red-600 font-bold
Table structure is clean with proper alternating row colors (bg-white/bg-gray-50)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Test path: Login > Accept 'I Agree' disclaimer > Home > Navigate to /children/approaches > Select 'Epilepsy - Including Status (SMC)' from dropdown > Scroll down to TABLE 4. The table contains 32 medications with 6 columns. Enter weight in kg input to test weight-based dose calculations. Check for 'Not available' items in red and SJS warning on Lamotrigine.
